description: Construction of a part two storey part single storey side extension and a single storey front extension
borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p style="">The proposed development would introduce&nbsp;unacceptable overlooking into the side window of No.94 Upney Lane&nbsp;at a close proximity. As such, the proposed development constitutes unneighbourly development and it is contrary to:</p><ul><li>Paragraph 130(f) of the National Planning Policy Framework (December, 2023);</li><li>Policy D6 of the London Plan (March 2021);</li><li>Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);</li><li>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);</li><li>Section 4.2 of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012); and</li><li>Policies DMD 1 and DMD 6 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037 (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021).&nbsp;</li></ul>

<p style="">The proposed development would introduce significant bulk and massing to the property. These are not in keeping with the character of the existing dwelling or the surrounding character.&nbsp; This would result in a development that materially harms the architectural integrity and unity of the dwellinghouses along the street scene. Furthermore the proposal would not present high quality design with the poor internal arrangement. As such the proposed development is contrary to the following:</p><ul><li>Paragraphs 126 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework (December, 2023);</li><li>Policies D1, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (March 2021);</li><li>Policy CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);</li><li>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);</li><li>Sections 5.1 and 5.4 of The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012); and</li><li>Policies SP 2, DMD 1 and DMD 6 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037(Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021).</li></ul>
